description: Two birds perch on a branch, one recounting a dream to the other. The dream involves the speaker experiencing the ability to walk. This walking is described as versatile, allowing movement anywhere at varying speeds. The absurdity lies in a flying creature finding the simple act of walking a remarkable dream experience. The scene highlights the contrasting perspectives and limitations between different species through a surreal dream narrative.
caption: I dreamt last night I was walking. ... And I mean I could walk anywhere ... fast, slow ...
